Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: Robledo73
Reviews.Content: had plan to stay for 20 days, but was only there for 1 night. The room was not clean, there were hair everywhere. Left early the next day.

Reviews.Title: “ESA REEKS”
Reviews.Author: C B
Reviews.Content: Non-smoking room reeked of smoke. Staff sprayed heavy sweet deodorizers which made it worse. Both fans on continuous didn't help. Carpet so filthy, white socks worn two hours as slippers were OILY BLACK and covered in hair and smut. Gunk and dust caked along edges of carpet obvious without my glasses. Hair in tub, hair in towels & sheets. Receptionist made me wait several minutes while she worked with staff & contractors all three times (check-in, transfer request, check-out). Top of headboard coated in dust (dead skin cells of previous guests. YUCK!) so nowhere to lean to watch TV. Parking lot very hard to access - one entrance with no crossover. Hotel hard to get into lugging/pulling bags through the MANUAL double set of double doors

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, friendly & helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: maria c
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel in August 2011due to the proximity to Miami port. We were a little concerned about the surroundings, but we actually felt very safe. Free parking was a plus, and the taxi to go to the port was approximately between $20-25. You do not get room service unless your stay 7 days or more; however, you can get clean towels from the front desk. If you want service is an additional $7 dollars per cleaning. I thought the free parking compensated for that. We will come back for our next cruise departing from miami.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay no pool”
Reviews.Author: william S
Reviews.Content: Heads up $5 for internet Homeless around near by stores . No pool , Mattress little hard. Kitchen in room , clean place . Other than that it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, great Location, clean, Helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: deepdsouza
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from the 27th to 30th April. The place is ideal if you're looking for something clean, quiet and well located. The room was Clean, Clean sheets and service from frontdesk was very good. There is a walgreens located opposite to the hotel and also a Publix supermarket ...so getting eats etc were not a problem. The metromover is just a 5 min walk from the hotel which made it perfect to see different areas of Miami. The Seaquarium is very close to the hotel and so is down town and bayside. This place is perfect if you are going on a cruise. Aristides and Mariella were a great help.

Reviews.Title: “FIne hotel”
Reviews.Author: massiniezcurra
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel was clean. The bed linen and towels were very clean. The staff at the reception helpful and friendly. If you are not driving, the hotel is a short walk (approx 3 blocks) from the Metromover. A Walgreens is across the road. The only downside was that the TV set was quite dusty and old. But I would return to this place for sure.

Reviews.Title: “OK enought for a 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: patsea-travel-agent
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and very basic room. It was in a fairly safe area and there is a Walgreens and Publix across the street and 2 block the other direction is a liquor store. I only stayed 1night before a cruise and got it through Priceline. Probably wouldn't stay here again but it wasn't terrible. We went to the liquor store and then my cousin picked me up and we went to Bayside for breakfast and then to the cruise port and it was only about a 10 minute ride to the cruise port. For the right price (under $40) I would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Good value pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: BeeandJay
Reviews.Content: Our group of 5 stayed at this hotel for one night before our cruise. We picked it for the price and relative proximity to the cruise port. We had 3 rooms in total. Two of the rooms faced the freeway and some of our group complained a bit about the noise. Our room was on the other side, facing the Walgreens and we did not hear the freeway at all. If you choose to stay here, I'd suggest requesting a room facing Walgreens, not the freeway if you are a light sleeper. Check in was a breeze. Staff was very friendly and helpful. They suggested we walk under the bridge to an Italian Trattoria for dinner - Tutti Trattoria, I think it was called. Very good pizza and service.Highly recommend it. The rooms are basic, but clean. The port is approximately a 10 minute cab ride away. There is not alot in the area to see and do. There is a Walgreens and Publix accross the street and if you walk under the bridge there are a few restaurants to choose from. We did not have enough time to reallt explore the area, but I think the subway (people mover) is about 10 minutes walk away. Overall, good value for your money and decent for a night before a cruise. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value, Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Alitlserenity
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in January of 2010. After much research in an attempt to find a decent and reasonable place to stay the night before a cruise, we could not be any happier with our decision to stay here!!! This hotel is clean, staff is responsive and helpful. The rooms are clean and spacious plus the kitchen is stocked with pots, pans, dishes, silverware, etc. It's close enough to everything without getting hosed by the cost. $84.00 for a Sunday night stay $22.00 taxi ride from the airport $21.00 taxi ride to south beach $12.00 taxi ride to the port of mimai Walgreen and a Publix within a 3 minute walk. In addition, we ate an amazing lunch and breakfast at the Baklava Factory, which was about a five minute walk from the hotel. Our total bill for both meals (for two) was $28.00. Would recommend this hotel for any pre-cruisers out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Location”
Reviews.Author: SafireDrms
Reviews.Content: We just needed a decent place to stay the night before we left for a cruise. I picked this location primarily because of price, proximity to the port, availability of transportation to the port, and the nearby Walgreens and Publix. We flew into FLL, and had prearranged transportation from the airport to the hotel in Miami, the driver had a little difficulty finding the hotel, and Iâ€™d say if it was 5 blocks more in another direction, the area would be a little scary, but where it is was okay. We were 3 women traveling together and felt safe enough walking across the street after dark to pick up some last minute items from Walgreens. We checked into our room, on the 3rd floor. Donâ€™t expect a view; itâ€™s not too far off of the major highway (95 I think). There was a full size fridge, a sink and a microwave. The bathroom was average size for a budget hotel, 2 double beds, a dresser w/ tv a small desk w/ 2 chairs and another comfortable chair to sit in. The room really was decent in size, but the furnishings are low key at best. I should mention here, if you need internet, its 5 dollars per day. There was also a coffee maker w/ coffee available, some dishes, an ironing board and iron. Since our room faced the highway, I did hear some noise when the air conditioning was not running, but since it was running most of the time I really didnâ€™t notice the noise as a problem. One of the primary reasons I had chosen this hotel was they offered a shuttle to the port, which when we asked about it at check in, the clerk was polite enough to tell us taking a taxi would actually be a little cheaper. The taxi ride is a set amount of 21 I believe, and that was for a van, and the shuttle offered by the hotel was 10 per person. We also asked for a recommendation for nearby pizza that was good, and the clerk had several offers, and we went with her 1st recommendation of Mama Carusoâ€™s, and it was great! If you are looking for a well priced pre-cruise stay, or an economy place to stay for a few days, Iâ€™d recommend this location. There is no view, no pool, and nothing really nearby that would be an attraction to walk to, so this location is not for you if you want any of that. The staff was great, and I will probably stay here again before our next cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: bajangal45
Reviews.Content: The service at the front desk was efficient and pleasant. No hassle check-in. We had to pay for the entire stay at check-in, but they make you aware of that beforehand on-line. The room was very clean, no orders, ac worked like it should, TV worked, lights no problem, bathroom was spotless, toilet had a loud flush, but it worked, the shower worked properly (water got hot when it should). I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The price I paid was $74.99 per night and I think I got way more for the price I paid. The location was great for me, I was staying there because I was going to the Miami/Broward Carnival, which was 5 Min away. It was right off of the I95 (about 2 min way). I didnâ€™t take advantage of all the amenities: Kitchen with refrigerator, microwave, stovetop, Workspace with computer data port, Free local phone calls, Personalized voice mail, Iron and full size ironing board, On site guest laundry, Dining and cooking utensils provided, Wireless Internet - onetime fee of $4.99 per stay, Transportation available to port â€“ Additional Fee, Pet Friendly. The parking is free, which was an added plus. The only things I didnâ€™t like was how loud the toilet (when flushed) and the door (when closed) were. Canâ€™t complain about the view since, this was to be expected because of the area. The area wasnâ€™t desirable but it wasnâ€™t unsafe either. I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SeattleElaine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across the street from a Walgreen's and a Publix. It is 10 minutes walking to the free Metromover to Downtown and the Omni area. Vizcaya Museum is not too far away, also. The front desk personnel are extremely helpful and friendly. We had a fabulous time there.

Reviews.Title: “bad choose”
Reviews.Author: cipsan
Reviews.Content: we stayed on 2 th and 4 th in this hotel. Everybody believe me , if you choose this hotel, you will live bad times in miami. The first Everything , there is not any map in this hotel. You will find this hotel adresses very difficult. We opened my room door and we had a bad smell because there is a big trush in this room. I think so , there was a few days in this room. I said preceptions personal but they did not anything about four hours. I said again her and she came our room and take it. if you want to good holiday in miami , you must not stay here... Note: trip advisor must do drop its

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable & close to port”
Reviews.Author: amalitta
Reviews.Content: Went on a cruise end of February 2007 and it was in a decent location for leaving from the port (no, it is not directly across the street!), we rented a car, but they did have transportation going to the port for a fee. There is a Walgreens and a Publix nearby (within walking distance) to pick up anything that you may need for the kitchenette. It was what we expected for $100/night. The hotel was clean, staff was friendly and it was in a fairly safe area. One downfall - there isn't anywhere nearby to go out to eat, unless you have a car to go downtown or to South Beach. Regardless, we were pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “MOTEL 6 ON STEROIDS”
Reviews.Author: zymurgy1234
Reviews.Content: My next installment in a long line of hotel reviews. Amazingly enough up until now I have never stayed at an extended stayamerica. Greatfully, unless I am terribly hard up I will never stay in one again. This hotel is really a motel. It has the hardest bed I have ever slept on. As expected no one here speaks English but that was anticipated. There was a $70.00 fridge a hot plate and a desk that comes right out of MIKES used furniture. Let me say I have stayed in worse places but for the money this is not worth it. I recommend you spend the extra $100.00 and stay at a nice place. $150.00 is too much thanks Todd

HotelInfo.Name: Extended StayAmerica Miami - Brickell - Port of Miami
HotelInfo.Address: 298 SW 15th Street, Miami, FL 33129
